question: 頃
userExplanation: <ja>ころ</ja> as noun <ka>ごろ</ka> as suffix
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. When used as a suffix, it means <vocabulary>approximate time</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>around</vocabulary> (as in "around 3:00").
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as what you learned with the kanji. Bear in mind that it's pronounced <ja>ころ</ja> when it's a noun, but it's usually <ja>ごろ</ja> when it's a suffix, though some people say <ja>ころ</ja> in both cases.
